Timeline at time of deal: At least 50 million doses will be available from April to June 2021
Notes: AU purchased an additional 400m from the Serum Institute after the initial deal announced in January 2021. The first 100m doses were reported to cost 300m; it is unclear whether that price held for the additional 400m. GNI/population calculated without Saharawi due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now.

Price/dose used to calculated total price. Russia is reportedly also offering to provide a financing package for interested AU Member States. GNI/population calculated without Saharawi due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now.

Timeline at time of deal: At least 50 million doses will be available from April to June 2021
Notes: GNI/population calculated without Saharawi Arab Democratic Republic due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now. 10 USD/dose estimate provided in news reports scaled up to estimate total purchase price.

Timeline at time of deal: At least 50 million doses will be available from April to June 2021
Notes: GNI/population calculated without Saharawi due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now. 6.75 USD/dose reported scaled up to provide estimated total price.
Contract will not be made public "due to confidentiality clauses"

Sources differ on number of doses agreed to. A press release from the Gamaleya institute says 10 million doses (dated December 10, and earlier reporting from Reuters says 10 as well. However, other reporting says 25 million doses, or enough to vaccinate 10 million Argentinians (which would be at least 20 million doses)
Price provided in terms of price per two doses (40 USD); that price used to calculate price/dose and total price. Option to purchase an additional 29m doses.
Australian biotech company CSL will manufacture 50m doses of the vaccine in monthly batches (originally at 30m manufacturing, an additional 20m was added to the deal in Dec 2020)
The 51m doses agreement follows an initial, smaller agreement in November. Australia will have the option to purchase an additional 10 million doses
Beximco purchasing at 4 USD/dose for Bangladeshi government "at first" but will, over some unspecified period of time, decrease to the rate that the Indian government is paying.
This appears to be part of the 1b doses that Serum Institute has contracted with AstraZeneca
Will be provided for private sale in Bangladesh, for 13.27 USD/dose. Option to add another 2m doses. Price paid was put at estimated 8 USD/dose, used to estimate total price
Some reporting puts the number of total doses at 5.2m doses, but the RDIF reports 2.6. Price estimated at 10/dose; this estimate used to calculate total price.

Initial deal for 30m finished doses and 70m unfinished doses to be finished by Fiocruz and provided at no cost estimated at 127m USD. Later licensing and purchasing deal for 100 m doses was set at 362 m USD, although not confirmed by Brazil or AstraZeneca. Deal later increased to 260.4m doses; price scaled up based on estimate for the 100m doses.

Not clear if this part of the earlier reported with AstraZeneca for 100m doses (since increased to >200m doses). Part of a diplomatic push, the deal is made through the govt of India, where Brazil is apparently getting a 'special price'. Brazil is reported to be a sending a plane to India to expedite the delivery of shots so it can start its mass vaccination program. But the shipment has been delayed due to export approval issues from the Indian govt.
Purchase deal reached with private clinics in Brazil - the Brazilian Association of Vaccine Clinics.

The Brazilian govt announced the contract on 25 Feb. Price/dose based on reported total price. However, one day later Reuters reported that Brazilian prosecutors are asking to suspend the deal as the phase 3 trial data is not publicly available yet. The nature of this deal is somewhat unclear. Some reporting is suggestive that the arrangement is a private purchase between Precisa Medicamentos, a Brazilian wholesaler, and Bharat Biotech. However, Brazilian government sources suggest that this is a purchase from the Brazilian govenrment to Bharat, with Precisa acting as an intermediary based on national laws requiring such an intermediary distributor.
Deal between the Russian Direct Investment Fund (Russia's sovereign wealth fund) and Bahia state in Brazil.
Currently under negotiations but has been approved by Congress
Deal is still in negotiations. Of 63m, 50 will be received beginning of 2022.
This deal is made by the state of Sao Paolo and Butantan to acquire vaccine from Sinovac. Butantan providing fill and finish.

Initially, a day after the deal was announced by the Health Minister, President Bolsonaro said the country would not be buying any Chinese-made vaccines, throwing the deal into question. Now it appears that the vaccine will be manufactured by Butantan Institute in Brazil and that the purchasing deal with the government is through the Butantan Institute. Option for additional 54m doses exercised in February 2021; price scaled up from earlier reported total amount for 46m.

The contract is still under negotiation and therefore, no other information has been made available publicly. It was earlier reported as a donation, but new reports clarify that its a purchase agreement.
Verity will support distribution. This purchase is in addition to the 20m AZ doses already secured
Initial deal was for 20m, with option to add additional 36m. Canada exercised this option to extend another 20m in December

Timeline at time of deal: as early as second quarter of 2021

Notes: Deal for 20m, option to purchase another 56m
Sub-national government purchase by the province of Manitoba.
Being described as a preliminary but not finalized deal
Initial agreement for 2.5m doses. Colombia has been trying to secure upto 10m extra doses, of which 5m have reportedly already been secured.

The number of committed doses has been evolving, with the most recent press release on Feb 3 stating 240m doses from SII. Price provided based on earlier press release for 300m committed doses for a total price of 750m USD, equating to 2.50 USD/dose.
Most recent report from January 20, 2021 suggests that the arrangement is for up to 500m, but is not clear on how many of these doses are confirmed

The MoU is for a total of 1.1b doses. The complete doses will come from the advance purchase agreement with Novavax and an existing agreement with SII (through tech transfer deal with Novavax). 550m doses have been reported for SII but the new MoU does not specify this.

The MoU is for a total of 1.1b doses. The complete doses will come from the advance purchase agreement with Novavax and an existing agreement with SII (through tech transfer deal with Novavax). 550m doses have been reported for SII but the new MoU does not specify this.
Most recent report from January 20, 2021 suggest that the arrangement is for up to 200m doses, but is not clear on how many doses have been confirmed
In addition to the deal directly with AZ, Dominican Republic has secured doses from SII to account for the delays from others

Timeline at time of deal: Arrive by February 2021, with potential rollout in March
Notes: Price/dose calculated based on reported total price of arrangement.
Price/dose based on total price reported in contract between Dominican Republic and Pfizer.

First 50,000 of the doses already received in Jan. Total order size is a bit unclear, but 20m has been reported in multiple sources. Reporting states that deal is with the Serum Institute and "R-Pharma" but it is not clear which manufacturer this refers to. R-Pharm is a Russian drug developer that is partnering with AstraZenecaon clinical trials but has not announced a manufacturing deal for the AZ vaccine to date.
The total doses is a bit unclear but 40m is the reported number in news sources.
Option for an additional 100m doses. Price/dose based on leaked contract provided to the press that provided total price.
Deal for 225m, option to buy another 180m. Price based on leaked price/dose estimates provided by the Belgian foreign minister; this is higher than was reported a month earlier in Nov 2020.
Deal for 200m, option for additional 200m. Price based on leaked price/dose provided by Belgian foreign minister.
Initial deal was for 80m, with option to extend another 80. Option has now been exercised. Second contract for 300m signed in Feb 2021. Price based on price/dose tweeted by Belgian foreign minister.
Exploratory talks concluded December 17, 2020 for deal for 100m, with option to extend another 100m

Initial deal was for 200m with option for 100m extension; that extension has now been used an another contract for another 200m with an option for an additional 100m has been finalized (600m doses total available). Price based on price/dose reported in December 2020 for first 300m, same price applied to 500m now purchased. This price is higher than that estimated in tweets by Belgian foreign minister.
Price based on price/dose reported by Belgian foreign minister.
Preliminary talks for 30m dose purchasse, with option to extend to another 30m on January 12, 2021

Date reported here is the agreement was signed; however, the agreement was not announced at that time, and was revealed by reporting in Jan 2021. The agreement is reported based on documents seen by Reuters

Date reported here is the agreement was signed; however, the agreement was not announced at that time, and was revealed by reporting in Jan 2021. The agreement is reported based on documents seen by Reuters
Conducting clinical trials in country as well

The doses will be delivered in 3 tranches. Reporting on government contract puts price at 19.9/2 doses; this number is used to calculate price/dose and total price. The contract also says that any negative impact from the vaccine will not be the responsibility of the vaccine producer.

Price/dose based on reporting on contract with the government (excludes VAT) and is used to calculate total price. Danubia Pharma is acting as an intermediary between the state and the Sinopharm. There is some debate around the pricing with opposition arguing that the govt is purchasing at twice its actual cost and there is possible indication of corruption. No indication of the original cost at which Danubia is procuring the vaccine.
SII has reported that it will reserve half of its production for the AstraZeneca vaccine for domestic use (which would be 500m doses), although this has not been finalized with the Indian government.

The Serum Institute has stated that half of what it produces will be kept for the domestic market in India; it is unclear whether those doses have been purchased by the Indian government or otherwise secured. Price estimated based on price/dose for the 11m doses that have been confirmed to have been purchased by the Indian government.

First 16.5m doses provided free of charge; rest charged 4.01 USD/dose. Therefore, price/dose and total price does not accord with total doses. Approved for use and rolled out while it is still in Phase 3 trials. The total govt order is likely to be much larger, and will also be used to export vaccines to neighboring countries. Another 4.5m may be purchased by the government in the future; unclear if this is part of a contract extension or not.

The Serum Institute has stated that half of what it produces will be kept for the domestic market in India; it is unclear whether those doses have been purchased by the Indian government or otherwise secured.
This deal may be at risk - Indonesia failed to make first down payment in October. Total price and price/dose based on 50% down payment put at 225m USD.

The purchase agreement is part of Indonesia's drive to allow private vaccinations. The state owned Bio-Pharma has announced the purchase agreements, and private companies can buy the vaccine from them.

The purchase agreement is part of Indonesia's drive to allow private vaccinations. The state owned Bio-Pharma has announced the purchase agreements, and private companies can buy the vaccine from them.

Timeline at time of deal: 3 million complete doses expected to be shipped by January 2021; raw materials for 45 million doses to be produced by PT Bio Pharma expected by January 2021
Notes: Phase 3 trial site for Sinovac and recipient of tech transfer for local manufacturing. Plans that Bio Farma will be able to increase its manufacturing capacity to 250 million doses by end of the year, from ~100 million doses right now. PT Bio Farma has stated that the vaccines will be sold for approximately 13.50 USD/dose.
Joint production capacity of 40m doses/year. Unclear how many have been purchased by Iran.

The agreement is for purchase and joint production, but manufacturer is not clear. Total anticipated production is not clear but Reuters has reported purchase of 2m doses. Anticipated eventual manufacturing production of 40m doses/year.
Health ministry announced the 2m deal while receiving a first batch of donations from China
Single dose. Deal reported as having a price of "up to" 275m USD.
Reported estimated price/dose is used to calculate total price. Reports indicate actual price may be even higher.
JCR pharma has been licensed to make 90m while the other 30m will be provided by AstraZeneca produced overseas

Deal between the Russian Direct Investment Fund and SK Pharmacy, the Kazakh government's pharmaceutical distributor. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Price based price/dose reported by Lebanese lawmaker. To be financed primarily by a World Bank loan.
Final doses secured is unclear, but official sources state that this is one of the 3 vaccines made available in the country. No information is doses is available yet.

Final doses secured is unclear, but official sources state that this is one of the 3 vaccines made available in the country. Fosun's official press release mentions that deal may include up to 40m doses.
Final doses secured is unclear, but official sources state that this is one of the 3 vaccines made available in the country. Macau has already received 0.1m doses
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets." Duopharma will conduct fill-and-finish and distribution.
Pricing is unclear, but it has been reported that Malaysia is expected to spend 504.4 million USD on all vaccine deals
Preliminary purchase agreement

Pharmaniaga will conduct fill-and-finish at first, then manufacture locally. Pharmaniaga has signed a deal for 14m doses, but the deal for sale to the government is for 12m; not clear what is happening with remaining 2m doses.

A reported preliminary deal has been (subject to approval as in other countries) between the Russian Direct Investment Fund. However, Mexico's health ministry is now denying that any deal has been reached (see second link). Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets." There is some suggestion that there were separate agreements betweeen RDIF and Landsteiner for 32 m, followed by an agreement between Mexico and Landsteiner for 24m.
Sources differ on doses to be supplied, between 800,000 - 2 m
CanSino is a one-dose vaccine
Sinovac has been approved and deliveries have already started. Earlier govt press release mentioned 10m doses, but the govt has now secured an additional 10m
Quantity of deal unavailable, but total AZ purchase for 25 million, split between R-Pharm and SI
Quantity of deal unavailable, but total AZ purchase for 25 million, split between R-Pharm and SI
Both total price and prise/dose reported.
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Agreement in principle. Option to purchase an additional 3m

It is not clear if it is bilateral purchase or via COVAX. The press release mentions a total of 7.4 doses but for each vaccine only gives the number of people who will receive the vaccine. For getting the individual number of doses, each vaccine number of doses needed per person is multipled with the total people.
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."

It is not clear if it is bilateral purchase or via COVAX. The press release mentions a total of 7.4 doses but for each vaccine only gives the number of people who will receive the vaccine. For getting the individual number of doses, each vaccine number of doses needed per person is multipled with the total people.
Official North Macedonia sources have reported 800000 doses.
Plans to fill vials locally. CanSino conducted some of their trials in Pakistan.
Chughtai Lab is attempting to purchase for sale on the private market in Pakistan. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Price/dose based on reported total price for total number of doses.

The deal is under discussion as the Minister of Health of Panama sent a letter of intent to the director of the RFDI for an interest in purchasing 3m doses. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
4m doses were announced in November, but a December press release from the Panamanian governments puts the number at 3m. Price based on the reported total price for 4m doses, scaled down to 3m doses.

No details of the deal are available yet. The govt said its waiting to receive the signed contracts to make a full announcement. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Vaccine trials were conducted in Peru.

Pfizer tested its vaccine in Peru. The Peruvian Health Minister has pointed to controversies related to liability waiver in December and raised doubts about the deal; however, finalized agreement signed in February.

The govt news agency reported that "The Philippine government, local government units (LGUs), private sector donors, and AstraZeneca signed a memorandum of agreement (MOA)." More than 300 private sector actors "committed to shoulder the acqusition of more vaccines"
Reporting states that private companies will purchase the vaccines and donate half to the Philippines government. Total price used to calculate price/dose.
Still under negotiations, the Indian ambassador has indicated that at least 8m doses is possible
Total committed doses unclear; Bloomberg's report puts Gamaleya doses between 10-15m. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Doses committed based on Bloomberg estimate
Total price based on reported price/dose
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Price/dose based on total reported price. Other reporting has put this at 20 USD/dose.
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Unclear how many doses have been purchased; the government has declared the contract "strictly confidential". However, it is for at least 2.39m doses based on government reporting in Feb 2021.

Unclear how many total doses have been purchased, however, reporting has placed it at at least 1.5m. Some reporting points to 17.5m total doses secured, but does not specify the breakdown by vaccine company.
Unclear how many doses will be purchased, but reporting states that up to 175m may be spent on a purchase at a preset price/dose.
Uncertain how many doses committed. Reporting says approximately 20 percent of the population would be covered
The signing of this deal was kept secret until the first shipment arrived, sparking a political crisis in the country.

Price being paid is higher than the 3 or less that has been arranged elsewhere for the AstraZeneca vaccine (but aligns with the price paid by Saudi Arabia). Vaccinations have been suspended due to a lack of efficacy against the SA strain (B.1.351).
Arrangement originally announced for 9m, increased to 11m end of Feb 2021.
Reporting suggests that Pfizer offered SA the vaccine at a discounted 10 USD/dose price, but this has not been confirmed.

SK Bioscience has a manufacturing agreement with Novavax which was further expanded in Feb for licensing in South Korea. "Concurrently, SK Bioscience has finalized an advance purchase agreement with the Korean government to supply 40 million doses of NVX-CoV2373 to the Republic of Korea beginning in 2021"
Status of deal unclear, but the health ministry has reportedly asked to 'allocate' Pfizer doses as well.
An additional 6m added to deal, raising total to 13.5m in Feb 2021.
GNI per capita and population numbers reported from the govt website
GNI per capita and population numbers reported from the govt website

GNI per capita and population numbers reported from the govt website. Deal for TTY to distribute vaccine in Taiwan announced in October; however, TTY announced authorization had expired after they had failed to reach purchase agreement with Taiwanese government. Unclear if arrangement has gone forward.

Price/dose based on total reported price. The number of doses is unclear - initial agreement said only 26m of the total produced doses will be kept for the Thai market. Other reports mention that the govt has ordered 61m doses from Siam Bioscience
Unclear how many total doses have been purchased, but 30,000 doses have been delivered as of Mar 9, 2021

Reporting has put price at 7 USD/dose, this was used to calculate total price. Intention to purchase up to 6m additional doses. This appears to be separate from the COVAX purchase of Pfizer that has been reported.
Option to purchase an additional 30m
Total price based on reported price/dose.
Total purchase of 12m is reported, combined for AstraZeneca and Novavax. The Ukrainian Ministry of Health's facebook page reports 4m doses.

Conflicting numbers on the vaccine doses committed. Earlier Reuters article reported total purchase of 12m (combined for AstraZeneca and Novavax). But new information based on updates on the Ministry's facebook page mention 15m. Atlantic Council reports 12m doses for Novavax alone

Total price based on reported price/dose of 18 USD. Ukrainian government contracted with Ukrainian pharmaceutical company Lekhim to obtain the vaccine. In February, Reuters reported that corruption charges are being investigated against Lekhim as anti-corruption campaigners argue that the deal was too expensive. Lekhim was made part of the deal on Sinovac's request
No info on total doses, but vaccinations have already started in the country.
Scarce information is available on the deal, except that 3m doses have already been supplied to the UAE and vaccinations have started

Deal with manufacturer and with the UK government. Manufacturing arrangement for one of the vaccine components at sites in the UK (and the US). These sites are expected to produce 180 m doses/year. Excess supply above the 60 million produced at the UK factory may be made available to Novavax to sell to other markets.
10m of these doses will come from SII in India
agreement in principle' between UK government and J&J as of August 14. Additional purchase option for an additional 22m doses

Manufacturer and/or Distributor: [Valneva has a large facility in Scotland, UK government invested in it to support scale up]
Timeline at time of deal: 60 by second half of 2021; "two further options for additional doses - one for 40 million and the other, between 30 and 90 million - by 2025
Notes: Deal for up to 190m doses; if doses beyond the first initial 60 million are exercised, deal could increase to 1.63 billion total. The UK exercised an option for 40m additional doses in February 2021, leaving an option for a remaining 90m doses. Total price and price/dose based on price/dose calculated based on the 1.63b/190m doses calculation.
Price/dose based on reported total price. Unclear if dollar amount repored includes more than vaccine price but also manufacturing costs.
Price/dose based on reported total price. Unclear if dollar amount repored includes more than vaccine price but also manufacturing costs.

Timeline at time of deal: First 100m by end of March 2021, second 100m by June 2021
Notes: Original deal for 100m, with option for an additional 400m doses. In December, option for additional 100m exercised. In Jan, in talks for additional 100m to be exercised. Total price based on reported 15 USD/dose.

Timeline at time of deal: First quarter of 2020 if vaccine approved
Notes: Price/dose based on reported total price. Unclear if dollar amount repored includes more than vaccine price but also manufacturing costs.

Deal for an initial 100m, with option to procure another 500m for additional funding. In Dec, option for additional 100m was exercised. In Jan, in talks to purchase additional 100m (bringing total to 300m). Prices have been reported as 19.50/dose, but allocations from the government point to slightly higher totals, raising the cost to 19.91/dose, as reported here.
Option to purchase an additional 400m. Total deal for 2.1 billion USD, putting aside money for clinical trials and manufacturing scale-up, appears to be 10.50 USD/dose.

Timeline at time of deal: Up to 10 million in 2020, 25 million in 2021
Notes: Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Not yet finalized

Unclear if 10 million doses have been secured or doses to vaccinate 10 million people. News sources differ. A tweet from Venezuelan president Nicolas Madura says 10 million vaccines, so that is the number used here. Some sources also mention that some of the vaccine may be manufactured in Venezuela, but details are not given. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."

In August 2020, reporting that deal was under negotiations for 50-100m doses; no further updates available. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
